description_html:
Our team, the Americas Capital IT & Design team, is the strategic core responsible for the physical layer of connectivity within Bloomberg Offices throughout North America and South America. We design and deliver the physical IT, AV, and security systems that connect our people and spaces. This is a critical function that ensures network performance, scalability, and code compliance, directly supporting our internal customer base while also aligning standards with regional peer teams. 


We're the team behind the technology infrastructure that enables Bloomberg’s global workplaces. From concept to construction, we design and deliver the physical infrastructure. Our work ensures every Bloomberg office is built to the highest technical standards and ready for seamless operations from day one. 

 

The team creates and manages the complete lifecycle of our physical infrastructure projects within Bloomberg's portfolio in the Americas. We are the architects and owners of the telecom rooms, cable pathways, and data drops for the office space. Our primary project focus is North and South America, but we actively coordinate and align standards with peer teams that focus on other geographical regions. 


How we make this happen: 

  • Design Integration: We collaborate closely with Corporate Technology Engineering teams—Networks, AV, Security, and others—to turn complex system designs into buildable, efficient, and resilient solutions. 
  • Standards & Governance: We set and maintain Bloomberg’s global standards for technology infrastructure design, cabling, and implementation. This specialist is a custodian of these standards, making sure every project delivers quality, consistency, and scalability. 
  • Project Delivery: We manage the entire capital technology build process—Plan, Design, Buy, Build—partnering with internal teams, contractors, and vendors. 
  • A high-quality, modern design workflow that relies on a structured Needs Assessment, detailed Design Document creation, and rich Vendor Proposal reviews for projects across the Americas. 

 

Strategic Initiatives: 

  • Regional Design Standardization: Establishing next-generation IDF/MDF templates and cabling standards for high-density Bloomberg offices throughout North and South America, focusing on regional code compliance (e.g., NEC, local regulations in LATAM). 
  • Integrating Cellular signal availability and advanced PoE systems into standard buildout plans across the American regions. 
  • Driving the standardization of our physical infrastructure using CommScope products to ensure superior quality and warranty coverage, while proactively exploring new vendor products and technologies for future adoption. 

 

What’s in it for you? 

  • Work on high-impact, high-visibility projects that directly shape the physical environment of our offices across the Americas. 
  • Architect and drive strategic procurement decisions, influencing product selection and vendor performance across two continents. 
  • Partnership & Collaboration: Work hand-in-hand with design, real estate, operations, and procurement partners to deliver unified, high-performing workplaces. 
  • Be part of a diverse team that values strong communication and individual expertise in solving complex logistical and technical challenges. 

 

We’ll trust you to: 

  • Own the entire Low Voltage (LV) Project Lifecycle: Drive the project from initial design planning and specifying requirements through final project delivery and operational turnover for all North and South America locations. 
  • Lead LV Supply Chain and Material Governance: Manage the Bill of Materials (BOM), oversee kitted component updates, and ensure logistical readiness across all projects (whether materials are procured internally or by the contractor). This includes working with suppliers like CommScope to proactively manage EOL risk and pre-order critical components to ensure continuity of supply. 
  • Drive Design Governance and Assurance: Lead the comprehensive IT infrastructure design review and redlining process, covering all aspects of the design—such as power, space, HVAC, and end-to-end cable connectivity and conveyance in and out of the IDFs—to ensure each project is technically precise, operationally ready, future-proof and fully aligned with design standards. 
  • Manage Project Execution and Compliance: Coordinate all LV projects with strong project management skills, ensuring strict adherence to budget, quality, and regional logistical requirements while enforcing design integrity and safety compliance across the construction environments. 
  • Champion Standards and Team Culture: Be a steward of our design standards, ensuring they are upheld on every project. Fully commit to the team experience—being a mentor, a learner, and prioritizing clear, proactive communication with all project stakeholders and peer teams. 

 

You’ll need to have: 

  • Extensive (7+ years) experience in the design, installation, and engineering of complex Low Voltage systems, covering both copper (CAT6/6A) and fiber optic cabling. 
  • Strong project management and organizational skills for managing complex build cycles, timelines, and budgets across multiple concurrent projects. 
  • Proven ability to design, review, and procure complex structured cabling and IDF/MDF solutions for enterprise office buildouts. 
  • Mandatory familiarity with structured cabling systems, building risers, and managing both indoor and outdoor cabling infrastructure. 
  • Expertise in the design, layout, and capacity planning of IDF/MDFs for modern office spaces. 
  • Mandatory experience in the review and redlining of construction drawings related to IT, electrical, and mechanical plans affecting telecom infrastructure. 
  • In-depth network experience and knowledge of network architecture concepts (e.g., OSI model, VLANs, basic routing/switching principles) to inform and support physical layer design. 
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Power over Ethernet (PoE) standards and Telco (telecommunication) room requirements. 
  • Deep experience calculating power requirements, managing load distribution, and specifying requirements for Power Distribution Units (PDUs). 
  • Expert-level knowledge of TIA/EIA standards and NEC (National Electrical Code) as they pertain to low voltage and electrical separation. 

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills for managing internal and external relationships across multiple regions and coordinating with peer teams. 

  • A Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field, or equivalent work experience

 

We’d love to see: 

  • Familiarity with corporate network environments, including LAN, SD-WAN, and Data Center networks. 
  • Direct experience specifically utilizing CommScope products or having relevant manufacturer certifications. 
  • Knowledge of security technology, including access control and video surveillance (CCTV) system design and physical integration. 
  • Knowledge of Audio/Visual (AV) system design and integration principles. 
  • Experience or strong conceptual knowledge of Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS) or other in-building cellular/wireless solutions. 
  • Professional certifications such as BICSI RCDD (Registered Communications Distribution Designer). 
  • Experience managing LV projects or vendors across multiple countries/regions (e.g., US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil).

title: Machine Learning Team Lead - Artificial Intelligence
description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, delivering trusted data, news, and insights that bring transparency, efficiency, and fairness to markets. The Bloomberg Terminal connects influential communities across the global financial ecosystem via reliable technology that enables our customers to make informed decisions and foster collaboration.
For over a decade, Bloomberg has been a trailblazer in financial applications of AI, machine learning, and natural language processing (NLP). The Artificial Intelligence group is responsible for driving adoption of these technologies at Bloomberg, with over 300 research engineers working collaboratively to provide clients with the best-in-class news, research, market data, and analytics.

The AI group contributes to Bloomberg’s flagship products such as news, research, pricing, communications platforms, search and discovery tools. We work on a variety of AI subfields, including NLP, information retrieval, time series analysis, and recommender systems.

We are looking for Machine Learning Team Leads in Toronto, who will guide and support teams of research engineers and software developers working on initiatives in query understanding and code generation. In this capacity, you will provide technical leadership, mentor team members, and manage projects from end-to-end. You will work hand-in-hand with key stakeholders across the business, and partner closely with Product, Data and our broader Code Generation organisation in NYC, to align technical objectives with business needs, drive innovative applications of cutting-edge GenAI techniques, and ensure the successful deployment of state-of-the-art models tailored for financial code generation tasks.

What’s In it for you:

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Machine Learning Engineering Team Lead who will be responsible for leading a team of ML engineers that are driving applied research in ML/NLP and bringing innovative solutions to data-driven customer-facing products. You will lead the development and application of the state-of-the art machine learning models including leveraging cutting-edge NLP techniques such as Large Language Models (LLMs).

You will be collaborating with subject matter experts to gain valuable insights and use their domain expertise to guide building high quality machine learning models. You will closely be working with product owners, our domain experts, data engineers and front-end engineers to build and integrate ML solutions to our product.

We'll trust you to:
  • Participate in the development process of ML based financial products as a technical leader
  • Collaborate with colleagues on production machine-learning systems and applications
  • Design, experiment, and evaluate software systems
  • Write, test, and maintain production-quality code
  • Represent Bloomberg at conferences and open-source communities
  • Demonstrate technical leadership by owning cross-team projects
  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support fault tolerant and testable systems
You'll need to have:
  • Extensive experience building and deploying Machine Learning models to production
  • Extensive experience in software engineering
  • Previous experience in leadership, managing and coaching globally distributed teams and influencing third party technology strategy
  • A Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience
  • Ability to effectively communicate, challenge and influence team members, peers, and stakeholders
  • History of successfully delivering on key initiatives and driving long-term strategic technology plans
We'd love to see:
  • Demonstrated experience of building a suite of applications with extensibility in mind
  • Previous experience in a team leader capacity
  • An understanding and appreciation for agile development practices
  • Financial domain knowledge and experience (not required)

description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 26,000+ employees across more than 150 locations around the world, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

What's the role?
Market Specialists support our Sales teams serving as subject matter experts within Bloomberg. On any given day in this role, you will be consulting with senior decision makers at client accounts, helping to close new sales opportunities, and providing critical feedback to help shape the development of our tools and services with the product management teams. By championing the Bloomberg Professional Service at market events and through printed material, you become the face of our company!

The Market Specialists are comprised of a broad spectrum of individuals with varying backgrounds and skills with experience from the buy-side, sell-side, as well as market and industry participants. The team's core responsibility is not only to heighten our user base’s experience and impact sales revenue, but also play a vital role in improving the knowledge of our sales force, and are a dedicated source of client feedback for our product development teams. The team also highlight their market expertise through writing for a variety of publications or speaking at internal and external events.

We'll trust you to:
  • Utilise your strong market experience, detailed knowledge of industry trends, and demonstrated technical skills to drive revenue opportunities across our suite of solutions
  • Act in an advisory capacity to our clients around the challenges that they face, and how they can use our products and technology to solve them
  • Develop an in depth understanding of the competitor landscape and how this affects both internal and external customers
  • Influence the direction of Bloomberg products through thought leadership, contribution on innovative ideas, and establishing relationships between Bloomberg's decisions makers and our clients
  • Develop and establish your own road-map of initiatives based off your in depth understanding of markets, tools, and workflows that align with product, sales, and company goals, and then maintain check-in points, and self-report successes and challenges on these strategies
  • Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives and goals
  • Seek out additional ways to make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement

You'll need to have:
  • Minimum 7 years of experience in Cash Equities in a sales, trading, or research capacity in the sell-side or buy-side 
  • Strong C-suite networks across the buy-side in India
  • The ability to convey complex ideas and solutions in a simple and concise way to audiences both large and small
  • Strong communication skills to be able to credibly lead senior level client conversations, gain insight into clients' enterprise workflow and promote Bloomberg solutions
  • The business insight required to use your knowledge and experience to make good judgement and quick decisions to tangibly impact the commercial success of our business
  • A reciprocal and commercial approach, along with the ability to operate within both departmental and company-wide initiatives, in a non-hierarchical structure without corporate titles
  • Excellent presentation, training, and communication skills in English

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional

We’re individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and experiences who take on big challenges and create even bigger impact through our work. We’re interested in what makes you you, and how we can create opportunities for you to channel your unique, personal energy and grow to your fullest potential.

Learn more about our office and benefits:

title: Overnight Master Control Transmissions Operator - Contract
description_html:
Bloomberg LP has built a significant media business spanning television, digital, magazine, radio and live event platforms across the globe. In the midst of a historic time in the media industry, Bloomberg Media is growing its global footprint and reach through new innovations from Bloomberg Originals, Bloomberg TV+, and Bloomberg Businessweek, among others.

We are looking for a Master Control Transmissions Operator to join our Global Broadcast Operations team. We’re looking for someone who takes pride in their work, thrives under high stakes, and brings a calm presence to a fast paced live environment. This is an opportunity to be part of a team that keeps broadcasts running 24/7 and ensuring they are of the highest quality. If you are an expert broadcast professional who thrives in a fast paced, high tech environment, we want to hear from you.

What You’ll Do:

Own the Control Room: Take charge of live broadcast operations, ensuring detailed coordination of guest shots, IFB setup, and routing of all inbound and outbound feeds.

Global Video Management: Be responsible for critical live video signals including Bloomberg Terminal and web streams, maintaining consistent quality and minimal disruptions.

Maintain Broadcast Integrity and Excellence: Partner with internal and external teams globally to ensure broadcast and playback content is transmitted consistently. This includes confirming content is synchronized with the broadcast log. Maintain a high level of technical and communication standards.

Innovate the Transmission Process: Apply innovative technology like Live-U, Fiber/IP solutions and advanced broadcast systems to open up the boundaries of what’s possible in real time news transmission.

What You’ll Bring:
Shown Expertise: You have experience in broadcast operations and live television, preferably within high-pressure environments.

Technical Mastery: You are proficient with industry standard technologies such as Live-U, fiber/IP solutions, RTS panels, satellites and more.

Critical Thinking and Problem Solving: You can troubleshoot and resolve technical issues quickly and accurately under tight deadlines. You have an outstanding eye for detail.

Communication Skills: You can collaborate optimally with all team members including talent, producers, and crew, to keep operations running efficiently.

What’s in it for You:

Work with the Best: Join a global leader in media innovation, collaborating with top talent in broadcast operations, engineering, and production. Your work will have a direct impact on delivering critical, real-time news to a global audience.

Career Growth: With Bloomberg’s global reach, there are endless opportunities to advance, develop new skills, and broaden your expertise across multiple media platforms.

Shape the Future: Be at the forefront of evolving broadcast technology in one of the most multifaceted industries in the world.

Dynamic Environment: You’ll be part of a high-performance culture that values creativity, precision, and continuous improvement.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or birthing parent/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

New Business Development Specialist , BloombergNEF - Bloomberg Financial Solutions
description_html:
The Opportunity:

BloombergNEF (BNEF) is seeking an experienced, highly motivated individual to join our North America commercial team as a New Business Relationship Manager. The candidate will lead BNEF’s business development efforts across the New York and broader Northeast US region. Specifically, the candidate will focus on financial institutions in the region — including asset managers, investment banks, private equity firms, insurance companies, and other capital market participants — who are looking to deepen their understanding of the energy transition, energy needs to support digital infrastructure (AI/Data Centers) and sustainable investing opportunities.
BNEF supports financial sector decision-makers with actionable insights spanning clean energy, advanced transportation, sustainable finance, carbon markets, climate risk, power & utilities, energy & digital infrastructure, and emerging climate technologies. This role will be based in New York with frequent travel across the Northeast to visit clients and attend key industry events.

Our Team:

BloombergNEF (BNEF) is a strategic research provider covering global commodity markets and the disruptive technologies driving the transition to a low-carbon economy. Our expert coverage assesses pathways for the power, transport, industry, buildings and agriculture sectors to adapt to the energy transition. We help commodity trading, corporate strategy, finance and policy professionals navigate change and generate opportunities. BNEF is a business unit of Bloomberg L.P. and has 250 staff based in London, New York, Houston, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Beijing, Hong Kong, Munich, New Delhi, São Paulo, Singapore, Sydney, Tokyo, and Zurich.

To succeed at BNEF we need people who can work in collaborative manner working with multiple stakeholders, yet be an independent thinker who will take ownership over their customer challenges. We don't rely on the status quo, we look for innovative yet pragmatic thinking that turns big ideas into real insights and impact. Working at BNEF sometimes feels chaotic; we need teams that are both dynamic and structured to generate the unique perspectives our clients really value. Our teams are diverse, creative, focused, and fun!

The Role:

The candidate will lead BNEF new business initiatives across New York and the broader Northeast US region, working closely with the Bloomberg terminal sales team in the region. This role will be reporting to BNEF's Head of Business Development for Northeast, Midwest and Eastern Canada. The candidate will look after BNEF’s growing client base across financial institutions in the Northeast US. You will help to originate new client relationships and scale existing client accounts to meet our accelerated growth targets. This candidate will play a critical role in connecting the dots between BNEF's research and the Bloomberg terminal product. Ideally the candidate will have a working knowledge and experience in the evolving energy transition, sustainability and climate tech space. The candidate will have excellent interpersonal skills, an intellectual interest in and capacity for becoming highly conversant in energy, sustainability, and decarbonization strategy related topics. The candidate will have an ability to manage a wide range of responsibilities in parallel.


We'll trust you to:

-Originate new client relationships for BNEF’s product offering and services

-Work on strategic development of key client relationships in conjunction with the BNEF account management team

-Collaborate with counterparts in Bloomberg's terminal business in the territory to grow and expand existing relationships and pursue new leads

-Travel and conduct face-to-face meetings with clients and prospects in the territory

-Coordinate client events by inviting clients/prospects and handling logistics

-Assist in the preparation of major sales activities, such as content presentations to senior audiences

-Provide constructive feedback to product and analysis teams regarding client needs

-Manage proposals and contracts


You'll need to have:

-A Bachelor's Degree at a minimum

-Minimum of five years of experience building energy, utility, industrial and/or tech industry relationships

- Experience building enterprise relationships

-A track record of exceeding sales targets year over year

-A strong interest and experience in energy transition and sustainability

-Desire and ability to travel to conduct face-to-face meetings with clients and prospects

-A confirmed ability to work on parallel tasks and collaborate across teams

-An assiduous attention to detail

We'd love to see:

-Excellent interpersonal skills

-Experience carrying a sales target and exceeding revenue expectations

-Knowledge or experience with the Bloomberg terminal and/or BNEF’s web product

-Experience using LinkedIn Sales Navigator and related sales tools

Operational Resilience Communications Lead
description_html:
Bloomberg is seeking an Operational Resilience Communications Lead to own and drive the firm’s resilience-related communications strategy. This role will lead a small global team to work cross functionally with Business Leads, Engineering, Information Security, Security Operations, Incident Management, Legal, Risk, Compliance, Corporate Communications, and Client-Facing teams and ensure that messaging, whether during service disruptions or in steady-state, is timely, accurate, and aligned across internal teams, clients, and regulators. The ideal candidate brings both strategic crisis communications expertise and the ability to execute swiftly in fast-moving situations. 

We’ll trust you to: 
- Lead all aspects of OpRes communication activities, including incident response messaging, proactive awareness campaigns, and post-incident updates. 
- Maintain and operationalize the OpRes Communications Playbook, including the creation and maintenance of templates, trackers, and pre-approved messaging and communication playbooks for various incident types (e.g., engineering incidents, data breaches, malware, or physical security breaches). 
- Own coordination across all incident types, in partnership with incident management teams, driving incident response calls, gathering facts, assessing impact, and determining the appropriate response strategy, including stakeholder engagement and communications. 
- Support stakeholder communications: 
- Internal: Share clear updates on incident status, potential risks, and recommended actions. 
- External: Provide timely and transparent information on impact, mitigation steps, resolution progress, and post-incident reports. 
- Act as liaison across teams handling client, regulatory, and resilience-related communications to maintain consistent messaging under tight deadlines. 
- Drive Post-Incident Improvement: Lead after-action reviews to evaluate communication effectiveness and identify opportunities to refine playbooks and processes. 
- Document & Measure: Maintain records of incident communication activities, including timelines, messages, approvals, and stakeholder feedback. 
- Define and monitor KPIs to evaluate the effectiveness of response and preparedness programs. 

You’ll need to have: 
- 10+ years in technical or operational response teams, as well as 5 years in leadership and people management. 
- Outstanding communication and judgement under pressure, with the ability to make sound decisions on limited information. 
- Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to track multiple workstreams simultaneously.

description_html:
Our Sales teams put the industry's most powerful Portfolio & Risk Analytics solution at the fingertips of global investment professionals. Our Buyside Enterprise Solution helps our clients make quicker and more informed decision by empowering them with the tools to define appropriate investment universes with benchmarks, implement optimal investment portfolio strategies, easily and accurately measure portfolio risk and return, and streamline their overall investment management workflow.


What’s the role?
As an Account Manager, you’ll be responsible for driving usage and adoption across firms using our Portfolio & Risk Enterprise Products, and for identifying upselling opportunities within accounts to expand the use of Bloomberg solutions. You’ll work closely with Implementation, Support, and Operations to ensure firms are using the enterprise solution as intended and supported at the level the buy-side community expects from a strategic investment technology partner.

You’ll build strong relationships across your coverage and find opportunities to expand the firm’s use of buy-side enterprise services. You’ll demonstrate credibility with competency and knowledge of the buy-side community and have a deep understanding of fundamental portfolio management concepts such as performance attribution, multi-factor risk models, and portfolio optimization.


We'll trust you to:
- Build, own, and manage relationships with key customers, including C-suites and senior management. Utilise these relationships to understand strategic business objectives and requirements, and to work with them in achieving their goals by using Bloomberg Portfolio & Risk Analytics solutions;
- Understand the client’s business, infrastructure, and key workflows with the goal of (1) optimising their use of our solutions and of (2) finding opportunities to generate revenue by upselling our full range of Portfolio & Risk Enterprise Solutions across new teams and functions;
- Develop and implement strategies that promote usage, adoption, and retention of our solutions. This includes making sure that (1) clients are fully equipped and trained on how to use our Portfolio & Risk Analytics tools, that (2) client’s workflow is running well and fully optimised, and that (3) clients are satisfied and well supported by various members of our team.
- Become a key partner of the client’s in-house team. Our client will see you as part of their own team and rely on you to lead and coordinate Portfolio Analytics projects;
- Be the go-to person to share knowledge across Bloomberg Risk and Performance Models and to share industry best-practices with front, middle, and back office, including senior level decision makers;
- Partner with Bloomberg Product Managers, Risk Model Research teams and Engineers to support strategic client development needs and organise the deployment of new analytics and reporting workstreams.


You'll need to have:
- 4+ years of client facing experience in Financial Services or a Financial Technology company
- Strong interest in portfolio analytics
- Deep understanding of Buy-side workflows and operating models
- Experience in advising clients on tools for Portfolio Management, portfolio construction and optimization, performance attribution and risk analysis.
- Deep understanding of fixed income attribution models
- Good understanding of multi-asset products and derivatives pricing and analytics
- Excellent communication and presentation skills, including the ability to understand and pass on complex concepts in a simple and clear way to clients
- Demonstrable ability to identify new prospects, and build and maintain solid client relationships


We would love to see:
- CFA, FRM or CAIA certification
- Practical knowledge and experience of APIs or Power BI would be an advantage but is not a prerequisite


If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know the next steps but in the meantime feel free to browse this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/product/portfolio-risk-analytics/

title: Portfolio & Risk Analytics Implementation Specialist, Enterprise Services, Bloomberg Financial Solutions
description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our 20,000+ employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.


The Bloomberg Financial Solutions department of 5,000+ employees is at the forefront of ensuring success for our customers and employees alike. Our team comprises several key pillars: sales, service, operations, culture and brand. As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering exceptional end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg.



Our Team:


The Portfolio Buy-Side Implementation team is responsible for fully onboarding new and existing customers to PORT Enterprise, Bloomberg’s Portfolio and Risk Management. Main responsibilities will include Pre-Sales engagement, Data Ingestion Set-up, Workflow Configuration, and Analytics Reconciliation.

 

PORT Enterprise implementations require detailed project plan creation, regular partner meetings and in-person client training. Individuals on the team will be required to be well versed in multi-asset classes, have a technical understanding of dataflow, and will be required to have strong project management skills.


What's the role:


You will need strong relationship management skills and possess advanced product knowledge of PORT Enterprise and indices as well as an in-depth knowledge of fixed income and derivatives. This is an implementation role and could require regular travel to support clients across the Americas region. You will use your strong project management capabilities to coordinate all aspects of the on-boarding process, including working with the PORT and Core Sales teams, understanding the client workflow, providing in-depth trainings and assisting clients in reconciling data.


You'll need to have:


  • 5+ years of experience working in Buy Side financial institutions or alternatively, experience in financial engineering/structuring
  • Understanding of workflows used by portfolio managers, risk and attribution specialists
  • Excellent communicative skills, both verbal and written
  • The ability to effectively communicate technical/complex issues in a simplistic manner to various audiences
  • A deep understanding of Portfolio Analytics functionality
  • Knowledge of fixed income, equities, and derivatives
  • Strong communication skills in order to interact with clients and team members
  • Experience communicating with Engineering groups on extremely complicated and complex topics
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Experience leading cross-departmental projects with tight deadlines
  • Experience conducting trainings both internally / externally
  • Track record of meeting deadlines and setting priorities


We'd love to see:


  • Bachelors or Master’s degree and CFA
  • Strong analytical skills to evaluate problems and provide solutions 
  • The ambition to take ownership and responsibility of issues and handle them effectively through to resolution
  • The inclination and aptitude to pick up new technologies and procedures
  • Strong technical skills - Python, APIs, and SFTPs


What's it like to work here:


We work hard. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy where everyone has a voice - not a job title. Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more important than titles or position. Things move fast, and we want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. But it isn’t all about work. Giving back is one of our core values, and there are many ways to get involved in philanthropic initiatives from helping local school kids with their reading to helping clean up local parks and waterways.


What is Bloomberg? https://www.bloomberg.com/company/stories/what-is-bloomberg/


View our Benefits: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/careers/working-here/employee-benefits/united-states/?tactic-page=588601


Does This Sound Like You?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know that the next steps are.

description_html:
Bloomberg is the industry standard for financial data. It's our business and our product. From the biggest banks to the most elite hedge funds, financial institutions need timely, accurate data to capture opportunities and evaluate risk in fast-moving markets. The Product Delivery Management team works closely with Engineering, Product and Data groups to build empowered, autonomous and multi-disciplinary teams delivering the right product, in the right way, as quickly and efficiently as possible.

As a Product Delivery Manager, you will act as a strategic delivery partner, helping teams strengthen how they think about product, value, and users in the context of delivery. You will influence not only what gets delivered, but how decisions are made, how success is measured, and how teams orient around customer outcomes. This role blends strategic partnership with hands on execution to support a more empowered, product driven operating model across Bloomberg’s product and platform ecosystems.

In this role, you will be aligned to a specific product or platform space within Bloomberg’s engineering organization. These may include:
● Artificial Intelligence (AI)
● Enterprise Products
● Enterprise Data Tools & Platforms
● Terminal Products
● Internal Applications & Bloomberg Web, Arts and Media
● Platform and Technical Infrastructure 

You will be a key advocate for product centric thinking, ensuring that delivery decisions are grounded in customer needs, outcomes, and measurable value. You will help teams move beyond output focused execution toward outcome driven planning, learning, and iteration.

This role requires someone who can operate credibly at the strategic level, reinforcing and operationalizing direction through strong partnership and influence, while also rolling up their sleeves to drive execution, unblock teams, and turn intent into reality.

This position is a hybrid role with 3 days per week in our New York City office 

We will trust you to:
● Guide and advise leadership in communicating and amplifying product vision, goals and strategic themes
● Understand, evaluate and govern value streams 
● Partner with Engineering and Product to help develop and track product roadmaps
● Manage complex, cross-functional initiatives throughout the product development lifecycle from inception through launch
● Set the right expectations with stakeholders, see around corners, anticipate and mitigate risks
● Excel in managing initiatives but also keep an eye on the big picture and not be afraid to upend existing systems and processes if need be
● Assess, adapt and introspect right-fit delivery framework (methodologies, tools and techniques) most appropriate to help the team achieve their goal as efficiently as possible
● Improve team's performance by helping them to continuously reflect and improve, encouraging team cohesiveness through leadership and mentoring to facilitate successful delivery
● Be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment requiring good judgment and flexibility

You will need to have:
● 4+ years of experience or equivalent expertise in product delivery or a relevant domain area
● 4+ years of hands-on experience working with lean approaches and agile development practices
● 4+ years direct work experience in large scale  program management capacity, including all aspects of process development and execution, experience with client journeys, and demonstrated ability to synthesize process data
● Proven understanding of the product life cycle
● Experience working and leading in a collaborative multi-disciplinary team within an interactive process 
● Foundational knowledge of IT infrastructure, architecture 
● Foundational knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and software development methodologies
● High motivated, self-directed individual with the ability to work independently
● Ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities
● Results-oriented attitude and ability to follow through on tasks in a timely and responsible manner
● Ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources, including upper management, clients, and other departments
● Excellent analytical, problem solving, decision making, interpersonal and communication skills
● BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related technology field

We'd love to see:
● An understanding in the finance and data domain
● An understanding of large scale software or system infrastructure
● An understanding of some key technologies behind AI (ML, LLM, time-series, etc)
● Certified Scrum Master or Certified Scrum Professional (CSM or CSP)
● Experience in leading or being part of Agile transformation in an organization that previously followed traditional/waterfall software development processes
● Experience using JIRA for planning and tracking
● PMP, SAFe Certification

description_html:
About the team:

The Company Data & Analytics team builds the platforms and tools that power company financials across the Bloomberg Terminal, our APIs, and Enterprise products—including flagship functions such as Financial Analysis (FA), Analyst Recommendations (ANR), and Estimates & Models (MODL). We steward the full lifecycle of a data point: from ingestion and processing, through data modelling and taxonomy, to API design and front‑end applications.

The role:

We’re seeking an experienced product manager to help drive our company financials data platform—a cross‑team capability that supports internal product groups and external clients. You’ll partner closely with Research Management Solutions (RMS) to design the tools, schema and syntax that allow clients to upload and analyse their own company financial data, and you’ll collaborate with our Private Markets team to extend these capabilities beyond the public universe. This role suits a strong collaborator who can articulate strategy while diving into bottom‑up technical detail.

We will trust you to: 
  • Influence the product strategy for the company financials data platform; set OKRs aligned to client value and internal adoption.
  • Map and improve client workflows (buy‑side research, company financial modelling) and translate them into clear product requirements and technical specs.
  • Design and evolve API syntax and standards for company financials (naming, versioning, pagination, error models), simplifying complex queries.
  • Deliver client upload & validation tooling with RMS (e.g., schema templates, mapping to internal taxonomy, validation rules, error reporting).
  • Support Private Markets expansion by shaping data coverage and schema extensions.
  • Write clear product artefacts (PRDs, API/SDK docs, acceptance criteria) and run discovery with design, engineering, and go‑to‑market teams.
  • Measure impact via adoption, retention, query success rates, API latency/usability, and coverage/accuracy metrics; iterate based on telemetry and client feedback.

You will need to have:
  • 7+ years’ product management experience or equivalent (including data platforms, analytics, or APIs).
  • Proven ability to define product strategy and OKRs, craft value propositions, and choose effective channels of delivery.
  • Technical fluency: comfortable discussing architecture and evaluating design trade‑offs with engineering (schemas, APIs, performance, reliability).
  • Experience designing data models and APIs (REST/SDKs).
  • Knowledge of research analyst workflows and company financial data (financial statements, KPIs; IFRS/US GAAP familiarity).

We'd love to see:
  • Exposure to Private Markets data and workflows.
  • Experience with Research Management Solutions (RMS).
  • Background with XBRL, taxonomy mapping, and data validation at scale.
  • Agile/Scrum delivery experience.
  • Degree (BSc/MSc/PhD) in a STEM field, Economics, or Finance; CFA is a plus.
  • Experience building or managing SaaS data products.

Product Manager - Data Rights & Entitlements Team
description_html:
Bloomberg runs on data. Our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Data, we are responsible for delivering this data, news, and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes.

The Content Acquisition (CA) team is an integral part of the Data department. We are responsible for managing, acquiring, and integrating content and data from Exchanges, brokers, sell-side, buy-side, and other types of providers to drive the value of the Bloomberg Terminal and downstream enterprise products. We lead the governance, cost, and quality of the data we acquire, and we collaborate with the wider company to develop our data acquisition strategies ensuring we are aligning with the agendas of our key partners.

The Data Rights & Entitlements (DRE) team ensures Bloomberg clients get secure, compliant access to the data they need. We build the systems that govern data rights, partnering across Product, Engineering, and Compliance to protect partner trust and make data access seamless and reliable.


The Role
We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager to join the Data Rights & Entitlements team within Data. Our team builds products and processes that ensure contributed data is accessed and distributed securely and compliantly, connecting providers and consumers through seamless, intuitive workflows.

As Product Manager for the Central Entitlement System (CES), you’ll own strategy and execution for one of Bloomberg’s most critical governance frameworks. CES governs client access to datasets in line with contractual, regulatory, and business requirements. You’ll work closely with Engineering, Compliance, Legal, and Product teams to deliver scalable, auditable entitlement solutions that instill confidence with clients and partners.


We’ll trust you to:
  • Define and evolve the vision and roadmap for CES in alignment with business and regulatory needs
  • Drive improvements across entitlement setup, mapping, management, and enforcement
  • Collaborate with cross-functional partners to design secure, scalable workflows that reduce operational risk
  • Translate stakeholder needs into clear requirements and work with Engineering to deliver solutions in an Agile environment
  • Use data, audits, and feedback to measure success and strengthen entitlement enforcement
  • Stay current on data governance practices and regulatory trends, adapting CES as requirements evolve


You’ll need to have:
  • 4+ years of Product Management experience, with a track record of delivering outcomes in complex, technical environments
  • Familiarity with data governance, entitlement/access management, and compliance frameworks
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to use data and metrics to inform decisions
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills across compliance, legal, and technical teams
  • Intellectual curiosity and persistence to challenge assumptions and drive better solutions

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you know what the next steps are.

title: Product Manager - Digital Assets
description_html:
Digital assets are evolving institutional finance. Asset managers are allocating to crypto, traditional instruments are being tokenized, and blockchain infrastructure is moving into core capital-market workflows. Bloomberg's expertise in data, analytics, and market infrastructure positions us to help institutions navigate this transformation.

What is the role?

We are seeking a Product Manager to lead Bloomberg's digital asset strategy across financial product areas. You will own the Crypto product strategy and shape the data and analytics our clients depend on, including crypto asset coverage and stablecoin analytics. You will also help guide Bloomberg's broader digital asset strategy by working with teams across the company to explain how tokenization and distributed-ledger technology are influencing asset classes, market structure, and traditional capital-markets workflows.

In this role, you will engage directly with clients and blockchain protocols in multiple regions to understand their needs and use those insights to influence future product direction. You will serve as a voice for the digital asset transition and help teams across Bloomberg understand how their offerings should evolve. You will communicate with and influence stakeholders at every level of the organization, adjusting your approach depending on the audience to ensure our solutions remain relevant and aligned with strategic priorities.

You will work closely with partners across the company to validate strategies, identify opportunities, and drive alignment on digital-asset initiatives. This is a high-visibility role shaping how Bloomberg serves clients in an evolving market.

We’ll trust you to:
  • Define and evolve the Crypto product strategy using a prioritization framework that drives measurable outcomes
  • Partner with institutional clients in all regions to understand workflows, identify opportunities, and translate needs into product strategies
  • Serve as Bloomberg's subject-matter expert on digital assets and maintain a strong understanding of blockchain technology, tokenization, custody models, and market structure
  • Drive cross-organizational digital-asset strategy by educating peers, establishing clear frameworks, identifying interdependencies, and aligning priorities
  • Represent Bloomberg in client discussions, industry working groups, and conferences
  • Work with senior leadership on strategic direction and prepare recommendations and updates that help shape Bloomberg's digital-asset priorities
You’ll need to have:
  • 8 +years of product management or strategy experience in financial markets and technology
  • A strong foundation in capital-markets infrastructure, trading workflows, or financial data products
  • Experience creating a product vision and roadmap, assessing technical trade-offs, managing competing priorities, and overseeing releases
  • A proven track record of influencing outcomes in matrixed organizations and driving strategy across multiple stakeholder groups without direct authority
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to work across cross-functional teams, present to leadership, and external audiences
We’d love to see:
  • At least two years of experience working with digital assets in institutional contexts
  • Experience with blockchain technology, tokenization models, or on-chain data systems
  • Existing relationships with institutional crypto clients or blockchain protocol teams
  • A history of building product strategy in emerging or ambiguous market segments

title: Product Manager - End User Computing
description_html:
About Employee Experience at Bloomberg 
A great employee experience is foundational to our ability to build great products and services for our clients. From HR systems to collaboration tools, from workplace security to facilities technology, our employee experience stack supports every individual at Bloomberg in doing their best work. 

Our mission is to ensure that employees have seamless, intuitive, and secure tools that enable productivity, drive engagement, and reinforce a culture of excellence—whether they're working from one of our global offices or remotely. 

End User Computing (EUC) plays a critical role in that mission—providing the physical and virtual computing environment that employees rely on every day. From OS-level software to endpoint performance, from privileged access control to secure remote connectivity, we strive to deliver modern, secure, and responsive employee devices and workspaces. 

What’s the Role? 
As a Product Manager for End User Computing, you will define, evolve, and execute the product vision for the Bloomberg employee device ecosystem, including Windows and macOS platforms. You’ll work at the intersection of technology, security, and user experience to ensure our computing environment is modern, scalable, employee-centric and secure. 

You’ll collaborate with Engineering, CTO, IT operations, security and compliance teams to create consistent, high-performing experiences across physical and virtual endpoints. Your work will directly impact how thousands of employees securely interact with their tools, access internal systems, and stay productive from any location. 

We’ll Trust You To: 
  • Define the EUC product strategy and roadmap, aligned to broader employee experience, IT and security goals 
  • Own and evolve the product roadmap for end user hardware and accessories/peripherals by incorporating key stakeholder requirements and end user needs 
  • Translate business, technical, and security requirements into a cohesive and intuitive end-user computing experience 
  • Identify and prioritize key initiatives across Windows/macOS platforms, patching, device management, and telemetry 
  • Drive execution across the EUC stack by collaborating multiple teams. 
  • Lead backlog grooming and roadmap planning across core components including OS imaging, policy management (MDM, GPO), software deployment, and endpoint configuration. 
  • Drive continuous improvement through end-user feedback, performance monitoring, incident analysis, and change impact assessment 
  • Partner closely with InfoSec and Risk to define and enforce EUC security requirements, including endpoint protection and patch hygiene. 
  • Develop user-facing training, comms, and documentation for major EUC rollouts and upgrades. 
  • Serve as a primary voice in communicating platform changes, support paths, and new capabilities to internal stakeholders and employees. 

You’ll Need to Have: 
  • 6+ years of product management or technical program management experience, with 2+ years focused on end-user computing or infrastructure platforms in large-scale enterprise environments
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills 
  • Ability to define a vision and roadmap across multiple stakeholders
  • Demonstrated experience delivering secure, scalable Windows and macOS endpoint environments 
  • Experience managing vendor relationships and driving work across global teams 
  • Deep understanding of device and OS policy management (e.g., SCCM, Intune, Jamf), enterprise patching, and MDM 
  • Experience with modern PC build processes
  • Strong knowledge of endpoint telemetry, performance tuning, and support tooling 
  • Familiarity with security tooling (DLP, EDR, EMP), access control mechanisms, and incident response protocols 
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or equivalent 

We’d Love to See: 
  • Experience deploying modern endpoint delivery and configuration pipelines 
  • Familiarity with user experience design
  • Success driving product decisions with data from telemetry, feedback, and user feedback loops

Product Manager - Fixed Income - Enterprise Data Products
description_html:
We are Bloomberg Enterprise Data - fast paced, innovative and expanding! We partner closely with our clients, taking time to understand their unique businesses, individual data, and financial technology (FinTech) needs. Our selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling enables our clients to get the exact data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. Put simply, our award-winning data helps power the capital markets! Bloomberg's Enterprise Data business continues to be a market leader when it comes to providing enterprise content for the financial services industry. Our offering includes best-in-class enterprise data, and data delivery via a fully managed platform. Our committed customer base appreciates the quality of our content, completeness of our coverage, data delivery, technology, tools, and high touch client service model.


Fixed Income Reference Data Team


The team manages solutions that are foundational and critical to the success of our Enterprise Content business. We have built a best-in-class data product offering that services client demand for completeness, timeliness and high-quality reference data. Reference data provides the foundation across pricing, regulatory, risk and our sustainable Fixed Income Data Solutions. This business is core to our growth strategy across Enterprise Data, and our ambition is to continue servicing the most complex demands and challenges of our clients so that they can keep innovating and delivering value to their clients. The team is responsible for identifying, creating, and designing data solutions that leverage Bloomberg's Fixed Income data. This requires an in-depth understanding of Fixed Income markets and familiarity with key market drivers.


What is the role? 


We are seeking an exceptional Product Manager to drive the continued development of our extended Fixed Income products  to define how we make Fixed Income Reference Data available within the largest financial data marketplace to drive client adoption and evolve the business. You will stay current with industry trends, engage directly with clients to understand their challenges, and collaborate across business units to ensure strategic alignment. You will be responsible for documenting our target client challenges and needs, understanding use cases, and then the design, evolution, prioritization and execution of a strategy and product rollout in collaboration with stakeholders. This will include defining product level and overall go-to-market and success metrics.


We will trust you to: 


  • Support product strategy by helping define and communicate clear goals, initiatives, and outcomes for Fixed Income Reference Data Products, and ensuring business needs translate into actionable product plans
  • Understand client needs by gathering feedback, identifying pain points, and helping prioritize features that deliver the greatest impact for our clients and the business
  • Collaborate across teams by partnering with Engineering, Support, and Data Operations to ensure deliverables are well defined, clearly communicated, and aligned with business objectives
  • Contribute to go-to-market efforts by working with Marketing and Sales to promote new products and enhancements, drive adoption, and support business growth
  • Engage directly with clients to build trusted relationships, expand our understanding of their challenges, and co-develop solutions through ongoing feedback and experimentation
  • Develop subject matter expertise in Bloomberg’s enterprise Fixed Income Data products, including the accessibility, usability, quality, tools, and services that enable clients to maximize the value of our content


You will need to have:

  • Strong knowledge of the Fixed Income Markets, spanning at least two of the following: Municipals, Securitized Credit, Corporate Credit, and Rates
  • Direct, hands-on experience with enterprise data products from leading financial providers, combined with a clear understanding of how enterprise clients identify, test, and evaluate datasets across vendors, as well as familiarity with data pipeline concepts such as data lakes, data warehouses, ETL, normalization, and linkage
  • Proficiency in statistics and data science tools and techniques, including Python, SQL, and cloud computing environments
  • Experience applying agile principles and collaborating with multiple stakeholders to deliver projects and initiatives successfully
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to distill complex topics into clear, actionable insights and effectively present business plans and updates to management or broader audiences


We'd love to see:

  • Demonstrated progression in current and previous roles, reflecting expanded scope of responsibility and leadership over time.
  • Proven experience in a client-facing environment, with a strong track record of cultivating strategic partnerships and delivering value-driven solutions.

title: Product Manager - Interest Rate Swaps
description_html:
Bloomberg Electronic Trading Systems (ETS) offers premier multi-asset trading venues and services, including workflows for the trading of Interest Rate Swaps.  As an IRS E-Trading Product Manager, you will help drive the overall strategy and growth of the electronic rates trading business. You will develop solutions for the local market and the global investor community by collaborating with key external market participants - including buyside institutions, liquidity providers and market infrastructure participants - and managing internal stakeholders to deliver market leading trading solutions.

What is the role? 

As an IRS E-Trading Product Manager, you will be responsible for increasing our footprint in the IRS E-Trading Dealer-to-Client market, with a focus on the US market.  In doing so you will increase market-share and focus on workflows for key clients in the Hedge Fund and Asset Management community.  Working hand-in-hand with Bloomberg Engineers you will deliver market leading workflows and execution tools.  Working with regional sales teams you will build liquidity for the E-Trading offering and encourage buyside participation.


We will trust you to:

Client-Centric Solution Design: Work with clients to identify needs and build solutions and trading workflows that provide a competitive edge. Engage directly with clients to understand their challenges and collaborate on developing scalable solutions.

Product Management: Ensure we have incremental deliveries and a phased product roadmap with clearly outlined business outcomes. Your leadership in product strategy, combined with your experience in project management will be crucial in driving continuous improvement and customer satisfaction.

Senior Level Engagement: Use your network to develop strong senior level relationships across the industry at leading buyside and sellside firms.  You may be expected to participate in Industry Associations.

Self-start: It is extremely important that you will set the direction for your business and own the outcomes.

You will need to have:

  • 10+ years experience in Fixed Income Rates markets
  • Strong technical understanding of Interest Rate Swaps trading
  • Demonstrated ability to develop thorough, integrated, commercially sound product plans
  • Technical proficiency in creating detailed Business Requirement Specifications to be used by engineers as a blueprint for the product you are developing
  • Demonstrated the ability to deliver technical solutions to complex problems in a fast-paced, risk-focused environment

We'd love to see:

  • Knowledge of Python
  • Product Management experience in a D2C or D2D E-Trading business
  • Strong understanding of technology architecture

title: Product Manager - Investment Accounting Analytics
description_html:
The Bloomberg Investment Accounting Analytics team develops advanced analytics that ensure compliance with global accounting regulations while supporting investment decision-making across the front and middle office.


We are looking for an experienced Investment Accounting Analytics Product Manager to join our London team as an Individual Contributor. This role blends deep domain expertise with product ownership, giving you the opportunity to shape accounting capabilities that directly support our clients and align with our platform strategy.


Why do we need this role?

- To strengthen the investment accounting capabilities supporting our Bank Treasury and Insurance product strategy

- To lead the platform-level investment accounting strategy, including support for IBOR initiatives in partnership with other departments

- To build in-house expertise that fosters strong client and stakeholder interactions

- To coordinate with upstream and downstream teams, meeting both business objectives and client SLAs

- To harness Bloomberg-wide and third-party technologies for more efficient workflows and better client service


We’ll expect you to: 

- Be the primary point of contact for a team of engineers in London

- Define and drive consensus on the foundational investment accounting strategy in collaboration with multiple business units

- Gather, document, and prioritize requirements, then execute across the full product development lifecycle

- Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless interoperability across Bloomberg applications and the front office

- Oversee validation and testing of analytics and workflow enhancements with engineering and QA teams before release

- Lead technical discussions with clients and business teams, ensuring requirements are aligned with client expectations


You’ll need to have: 

- 10+ years of experience building investment accounting analytics within a third-party system, bank, or insurance company

- A degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. Professional qualifications such as Chartered Accountant (CA) or equivalent are a plus

- Broad accounting expertise across North America, EMEA, and/or APAC markets

- Hands-on experience with US GAAP, IFRS, and/or Statutory accounting for investments, ideally across multiple asset classes (Securities, Alternatives, Mortgage Loans, Derivatives, etc.)

- Strong knowledge of accounting treatments for various asset classes and region-specific requirements

- A solid understanding of how investment accounting informs front-office and middle-office decision-making

- Proven ability to partner with business stakeholders and clients to define product strategy, requirements, and roadmaps, drive product development in collaboration with engineering and cross-functional teams, ensure seamless user experiences and scalable workflows, and participate in architecture discussions to ensure back-end robustness and scalability

- A forward-looking perspective, staying ahead of industry and market trends while leveraging Bloomberg technologies to deliver value to clients

- Client engagement experience, with the ability to understand and anticipate product needs


If this sounds like you, please apply!

Product and Licensing Counsel
description_html:
The Department

Bloomberg’s Legal & Compliance Department plays a critical role in supporting our businesses and operations around the world. We move quickly and thoughtfully to help address a variety of complex issues that come with being the world’s leading financial news and information company. Our team is made up of talented and hardworking legal and compliance professionals who think creatively and work collaboratively in an open environment to deliver results, drive innovation, and solve difficult problems.  We are committed to a workplace where all of our employees can thrive regardless of background, and where everyone feels empowered to make an impact. We also recognize the importance of giving back to our communities as evidenced by our award-winning pro bono program! 

What’s the Role

We are seeking an experienced Product and Licensing Counsel to join our Legal & Compliance Department.

As Product Counsel, you would support the development, launch, and governance of our global data and technology products. You’ll partner with product managers, engineers, data scientists, and business leaders across the Company to ensure our products are developed in compliance with applicable laws and reflect the Company’s standards for innovation and integrity. You will provide practical, business-oriented legal advice throughout the entire product lifecycle — from concept through commercialization — with a focus on product strategy, data use, privacy, AI, intellectual property, and regulatory considerations.

As Licensing Counsel, you would work closely with our business, product and sales partners to draft and negotiate the legal terms and conditions of our licenses for our data and technology services worldwide. Our colleagues depend on us for our deep product and commercial contract knowledge in order to support them in closing the deal. You will provide guidance to meet the Company’s strategic sales and revenue targets while protecting our business from undue legal risk. You will also oversee the work of Negotiations team members who are the first point of escalation for handling customer inquiries about the Company’s contracts.

We’ll trust you to:

• Advise Product, Engineering, and Finance teams throughout the product development lifecycle on product design and strategy, data use, and commercialization
• Identify and assess legal risks as products evolve — including in connection with advancing technology such as generative and agentic AI — and provide practical, business-oriented solutions
• Partner with colleagues in Legal, Compliance and Risk to advise on privacy, data security, intellectual property, and regulatory issues
• Draft and review product-related terms of service, user agreements, disclosures, and policies, and advise on marketing materials and client-facing communications
• Collaborate with Compliance and Risk to develop scalable tools and frameworks to help product teams manage legal risk efficiently
• Monitor emerging laws and regulations impacting Bloomberg’s technology, AI, data, and financial products
• Negotiate customer and vendor agreements for a wide range of licenses and services
• Advise Product and Business on challenging and complex licensing transactions
• Oversee the work of and provide training and mentorship to Negotiations team members

You’ll need to have:

• JD degree and active membership in the New York bar
• 5–7 years of relevant experience, including at least 3 years in-house at a technology, fintech, or data-driven company (or advising such clients at a top law firm)
• Strong understanding of product development lifecycles, especially for data/analytics or AI-driven products
• Strong, meticulous drafting skills, with attention to detail, and strong negotiations skills
• Working knowledge of intellectual property, commercial contracts, and regulatory frameworks relevant to financial markets
• Exceptional communication and collaboration skills with the ability to influence cross-functional teams and deliver clear, actionable guidance
• Practical, solution-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

We’d Love to See:

• Experience advising in the financial or technology sectors, with a solid understanding of core concepts thereof
• Proven ability to deliver clear, commercially focused legal advice under pressure
• Strong skill in translating legal and regulatory concepts for business, product, and technology audiences
• Ability to identify and use technology and data to improve efficiency and knowledge sharing
• Strong organizational and project management abilities, with attention to detail and follow-through
• Experience overseeing the work of other counsel or non-counsel colleagues
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/what-we-do/

Quantitative Analyst – Credit Derivatives
description_html:
Bloomberg FX/Commodity/Credit Quant Analytics Team

Join Bloomberg’s Quant Analytics team, where we design and deliver cutting-edge models for derivative market data, pricing, and risk. Our work powers everything from the Bloomberg Terminal (used by 300,000+ clients) to trading systems, enterprise risk management, and valuation services.

We’re looking for a Quant Analyst with deep expertise in credit derivatives to help us push the boundaries of analytics.

What You’ll Do
  • Build and enhance credit derivatives pricing models in C++.
  • Optimize performance and accuracy of existing market data and pricing engines.
  • Partner with engineers, and product teams to bring models into production.
  • Communicate insights clearly to both technical and client-facing teams.

What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years in credit derivatives modeling.
  • Strong knowledge of credit instruments (CDS, CDX, iTraxx, tranched credit).
  • Advanced programming skills in C++ (plus Python).
  • Solid grasp of mathematical finance, and numerical methods in derivatives pricing.
  • Proven ability to collaborate in a multi-developer, cross-functional environment.
  • Excellent communication skills.

Nice to Have
  • PhD in a quantitative field
  • Knowledge and practical experience in private credit modeling

Why Bloomberg?

You’ll join a team that combines world-class data, innovative models, and real-world impact at scale. If you’re passionate about credit derivatives and want to work at the forefront of financial technology, we’d love to hear from you.

RMS Implementation, Enterprise Services, Financial Solutions
description_html:
Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, news and insight, and we use innovative technology to deliver trusted data and bring transparency to the financial markets. Our customers around the globe rely on us for the information and tools they need to make critical investment decisions and remain connected across all sides of the financial community. And, to ensure the best experience for our employees across 176 offices globally, we provide the spaces and systems that allow our teams to work together with agility, productivity and collaboration, no matter where they are.

The Bloomberg Financial Solutions department is at the forefront of ensuring success for our customers and employees alike. Our team comprises several key pillars: sales, service, operations, culture and brand. As a department, we are united by a common goal: We create meaningful relationships with clients by understanding their needs and delivering exceptional end-to-end support from sales and implementation, through their ongoing relationship with Bloomberg.


Our Team

Bloomberg’s Research Management System (RMS) is a fully integrated buy-side solution that empowers clients to manage investment research efficiently, compliantly, and collaboratively. Leveraging AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP), RMS enables clients to uncover insights across one of the world’s largest libraries of broker research, company filings, transcripts, and internal notes. With seamless integration into Microsoft Office®, structured publishing workflows, and real-time collaboration tools, RMS centralizes qualitative and quantitative research, supports ESG engagement tracking, and connects to Bloomberg Query Language (BQL) for powerful analytics.

Our goal is to provide the most scalable research platform in the market — one that helps clients generate actionable ideas, manage compliance risk, and collaborate more effectively across the investment lifecycle.


WHAT IS THE ROLE?

The RMS Implementation Specialist plays a vital role in ensuring successful client engagements by combining deep product expertise with buy-side industry knowledge. You will partner with clients to analyze research workflows, configure RMS, deliver training, and ensure smooth integrations with portfolio management, compliance, and operational systems.
Unlike a generalist project manager, the Implementation Specialist is a hands-on product expert, guiding clients in how to best leverage RMS’s AI-powered document search, collaboration, publishing, and ESG management features. You will own technical configurations, advise on workflow optimization, and champion best practices to maximize client adoption.
The role is based in New York and covers new clients across North America, with some travel required for on-site support.

WE'LL TRUST YOU TO:
  • Lead RMS implementations from discovery to go-live, ensuring clients achieve business and workflow objectives
  • Translate client requirements into tailored RMS configurations, including publishing workflows, data integrations, and compliance controls
  • Guide clients on adopting AI/NLP-powered document search, BQL analytics, and ESG engagement management
  • Deliver engaging training sessions for analysts, portfolio managers, and compliance teams
  • Act as a product specialist during implementation, advising clients on maximizing collaboration tools, document annotation, and workflow automation
  • Partner with sales on scoping and solution design to ensure seamless handoff into implementation
  • Manage multiple implementations concurrently, balancing project timelines and stakeholder expectations
  • Provide structured feedback from client experiences to Product and Engineering to support ongoing innovation
  • Drive adoption post-launch by monitoring usage, identifying opportunities for expansion, and embedding RMS into client workflows

YOU'LL NEED TO HAVE:
  • 4–8 years of financial technology implementation experience, ideally in buy-side research or order management systems
  • Strong expertise in investment research workflows, compliance oversight, and data-driven analytics
  • Demonstrated ability to configure and implement enterprise platforms with technical integrations
  • Excellent client-facing skills: communication, training, and relationship management
  • Highly organized with a proactive, team-oriented approach
  • Prior experience working with AI/NLP solutions, publishing platforms, or data analytics tools a strong plus
  • Familiarity with Bloomberg applications preferred; knowledge of AIM and/or PORT is advantageous
  • Strong project management abilities, with a track record of leading complex, multi-stakeholder implementations
  • Critical thinking, problem-solving, and consultative skills with a proactive, client-first mindset
  • Strong Microsoft Office knowledge (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio)


What's it Like To Work Here?

We work hard. We are ambitious and set ourselves tough business goals. We are a meritocracy where everyone has a voice - not a job title. Working with people you trust, respect, and can collaborate with is more important than titles or position. Things move fast, and we want people who will enjoy working in this environment and feed off the energy. But it isn’t all about work. Giving back is one of our core values, and there are many ways to get involved in philanthropic initiatives from helping local school kids with their reading to helping clean up local parks and waterways.

What is Bloomberg?: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/stories/what-is-bloomberg/
View our Benefits: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/careers/working-here/employee-benefits/united-states/?tactic-page=588601
